 Review — Just in Time
 

 The Broadway Review: ‘Just in Time’ is safe, swoonful concert-style theater

 To no one’s surprise, star Jonathan Groff’s got the magic, vintage touch.
dtliExcerpt: But the manner in which “Just in Time” unfolds is mercilessly predictable, so the beats rarely surprise; we feel every snap coming. For what it’s worth, Groff, Lawrence and Henningsen don’t seem to mind — they’re having a howling good time slipping into these characters’ shoes.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Positive | Claude: The review appears heavily truncated with mostly navigation menu text, but the visible headline and excerpt suggest a positive assessment describing the show as 'safe, swoonful' and praising the star's performance as having 'magic.' | GPT-4o: The review describes the show as 'safe' and 'swoonful', indicating a positive but not overly enthusiastic recommendation. The mention of Jonathan Groff's 'magic, vintage touch' suggests a positive view of the performance. | Gemini: The review describes the show as "swoonful" and notes that the star has "the magic touch", indicating a positive but not overwhelmingly enthusiastic recommendation.
